result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel E Alloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 5 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

If defendant's health care provider indicates unable to work then employment condition will not apply.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any taverns/bars.

The defendant must undergo an anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must follow all conditions of chapter 51 treatment case.

The defendant must follow all rules of supervision.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week - unless it interferes with mental health treatment plan.

supervisions.notes:
Good time and huber allowed. Community service authorized under 973.03(3).

Court has no objection to serving in another county, but is decision of the sheriff.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel E Alloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel E Alloway in court with attorney Greg A Petit.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:07 pm. Resolved. State has complied with victim notification - no request for restitution (as parties agree that FCP tribe paid for the window which was broken) the tribe has not asked for restitution and victim impact statement is in file. Amend count 1 to  948.03(3)(b) class I felony and count 4 plead as alleged, count 2 & 3 DRI -  place on probation 3 years  - conditional jail time of 6 months (free to argue). Alloway agrees. Court DRI count 2 & 3.  Court amends count 1 to 948.03(3)(b) reads new penalties - pleads guility. Count 4 pleads guility as alleged. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds defendant entering pleas freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering his plea and waiving his right to JT, factual basis, accepts pleas and adjudges guility of count 1 as amended and count 4 as alleged. State final argument asks for at least 6 months in FC jail. Petit makes statement. Follow recommendations of Winnebago Co case asks if court imposes jail time that he can serve in Winnebago county and asks for huber for child care. Alloway withholds statement. Court sentences to following - count 1 w/hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 

Count 4 - 90 days jail (report 10/17/2014 @ 8 a.m.) with huber and good time (court does not have authority to transfer jail that is up to sheriff's but has no objection to transfer to any other county) - community service authorized under 973.03(3)

Count 1 - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years concurrent to count 4 - no consume/entery - 200 hrs co service - AODA and follow thru - anger management and follow thru - follow all conditions of chapter 51 treatment case - follow all rules of supervison - at least 1 AA meeting each week unless it interferes with mental health treatment plan - costs (felony) - employment with verbage (5) wkly - unless health care provider indicates unable to work. Provide DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

Voting and appeal rights given.
and certificate of appearance - Deputy JN
Final pre-trial on September 24, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Called at 3:20 PM. Daniel Alloway appears in person and with counsel Greg Petit. State appears by Charles Simono. State - believe the PH is being waived today due to a promise from the state of no prison time when/if sentenced. Alloway and Petit agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed an Information that mirrors the complaint. Petit and Alloway have Information, waives reading of it, pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT on 9/24/14 at 4:00 PM.
and Certificate of Appearance - Deputy AW
